<md>Hi folks, 

Below is an email from my dear senior colleague Bill Drummond in our School of Journalism.  He's a fantastic guy with a rich life experience that has taken him to many corners and nooks and crannies of the globe---from the White House to the turmoil in the South during the Civil Rights Movement, to Beirut, Jerusalem, and even to some remote areas of Pakistan and Afghanistan.

One of the many invaluable things Bill does is spearhead journalism activity for inmates at San Quentin Prison.  Please see the email he sent me (appended below my name) about opportunities that might interest you.

This article, too, might interest you, by way of background.  Please note that Bill has stated explicitly in his email that he welcomes undergraduates into his team.

<https://www.dailycal.org/2013/12/02/inmate-run-newspaper-seeks-expand-help-berkeley-graduate-students/>

Please direct all your questions to Bill—not to me.  

Cheers,

Babak.

\---------- Forwarded message --------- 

From: **William J. DRUMMOND** <[wdrummon@berkeley.edu](mailto:wdrummon@berkeley.edu)\> Date: Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 09:01 Subject: San Quentin News Editing Class To: Babak AYAZIFAR <[ayazifar@berkeley.edu](mailto:ayazifar@berkeley.edu)\>

Dear Babak,

I know it's a reach, but you might know of some aspiring engineers who might be interested in social justice causes.

 I'm recruiting a few good students to add to my San Quentin News editing class this fall. Undergraduates are welcome. Engineers usually have crushing course loads, but this course is user-friendly. The meetings all take place at the prison. Students spend 90-minutes inside San Quentin's Media Center a week. Most often we visit on Sundays. 

Most of the students say it's a life-changing experience.

If you have any prospects, please send them my way.

It will be a significant year. It's the 50th anniversary of the death of George Jackson at San Quentin.

Would appreciate your help.

Yours,

Bill

\--

William Drummond, professor of journalism

Author of "_Prison Truth: The Story of the San Quentin News_," published by UC Press
